Description: A packaged-ice company, headquartered in St. Paul, Minn., agreed to plead guilty and to pay a $9 million criminal fine for allocating customers. In addition, three of the company's former executives pleaded guilty for their roles in the conspiracy to allocate customers.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/minneapolis-packaged-ice-company-agrees-plead-guilty-customer-allocation-conspiracy

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 423310: Lumber, Plywood, Millwork, and Wood Panel Merchant Wholesalers
Info Source: August 24, 2018 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/116508/jenny-craig-settles-wage-and-hour-suit-for-1-65m

Description: Arctic Glacier and Home City Ice agreed to pay a total of $740,000 in settlement of allegations they conspired to reduce competition. At the same time both pleaded guilty to criminal conspiracy on federal charges. A private civil action was ongoing.
Info Source: https://wayback.archive-it.org/418/20101212102300/https://www.michigan.gov/ag/0,1607,7-164-34739_34811-243390--,00.html

Description: Classmates Inc.  and  Florists' Transworld Delivery Inc.  agreed to pay a total of $11 million to settle multistate allegations that the companies engaged in misleading advertising and billing practices. Classmates Inc.'s share was $8.2 million.
Info Source: https://wisconsindailyindependent.com/doj-announces-11-million-settlement-with-classmates-inc-florists-transworld-delivery-inc-ftd-com-inc/
https://web.archive.org/web/20101110021822/http://www.ag.ny.gov/media_center/2010/aug/aug18a_10.html

Description: Classmates.com agreed to pay $300,000 in settlement of allegations its email email solicitations - which misrepresented to consumers that people they knew were trying to contact them through the Classmates website - improperly induced consumers to purchase Classmates memberships and that Classmates failed to notify consumers clearly and conspicuously that their memberships would be automatically renewed unless they took action to terminate the subscription.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20161220120155/http://oag.dc.gov/release/classmatescom-agrees-improve-disclosures-pay-300000-settlement-district-columbia

Company: H.I.G. Growth Partners, LLC and H.I.G. Capital, LLC
Description: H.I.G. agreed to pay $19.95 million in settlement of allegations a portfolio company that it controlled, South Bay Mental Health Center, Inc. (SBMHC), violated the Massachusetts False Claims Act by hiring unlicensed, unqualified and unsupervised staff at its mental health facilities in the state while charging Medicaid for treatment services.
Info Source: https://www.mass.gov/news/private-equity-firm-and-former-mental-health-center-executives-pay-25-million-over-alleged-false-claims-submitted-for-unlicensed-and-unsupervised-patient-care
